greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if 1+phi(n) is prime, 0 otherwise, where phi = A000010, Euler totient function.
comment: Out of the first 65537 values, 26197 are 1's (indicating primes), and 39340 are 0's, indicating nonprimes.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: For all n, a(n) >= A010051(n) and a(2n) >= A010051(n).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2017
